com.here.sdk.mapview

Class MapPolygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.NativeBase
      • com.here.sdk.mapview.MapPolygon

  • public final class MapPolygon
extends NativeBase

    A visual representation of a polygon on the map. Can be used to visualize areas of all shapes and sizes. The geometry to be visualized is represented by an instance of GeoPolygon. To display circular areas (for example, a position accuracy indicator) use a GeoPolygon created from a GeoCircle using GeoPolygon.make(GeoCircle). Please note that polygons which are self-intersecting are not supported and may lead to render artifacts.

    To display the map polygon, it needs to be added to the scene using MapScene.addMapPolygon(com.here.sdk.mapview.MapPolygon). To stop displaying it, remove it from the scene using MapScene.removeMapPolygon(com.here.sdk.mapview.MapPolygon).

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapPolygon

        public MapPolygon(@NonNull
                  GeoPolygon geometry,
                  @NonNull
                  Color color)

        Creates a new MapPolygon instance containing the geometry passed in.

        Parameters:
        geometry -

        The list of vertices representing the polygon. The winding order of the vertices can be in clockwise or counter-clockwise order.
        Note: The polygon shape should not cover more than half of the globe, otherwise unexpected results may occur. Also self-intersecting polygons are not supported.

        color -

        The fill color for the polygon

      • setGeometry

        public void setGeometry(@NonNull
                        GeoPolygon value)

        Sets a new geometry to update the appearance.

        Parameters:
        value -

        The geometry of the polygon. Setting a new geometry will update the appearance. Please note that polygons which are self-intersecting are not supported.

      • getFillColor

        @NonNull
public Color getFillColor()

        Gets the current color of the fill. null if there is no fill.

      • setFillColor

        public void setFillColor(@NonNull
                         Color value)

        Sets the current color of the fill. Use fully transparent color (alpha set to 0) to disable the fill completely.

        Parameters:
        value -

        Color of the polygon's fill. Fully transparent color (alpha set to 0) disables the fill completely.

      • getDrawOrder

        public int getDrawOrder()

        Gets MapPolygone draw order. Default value is 0.

      • setDrawOrder

        public void setDrawOrder(int value)

        Sets MapPolygone draw order. Polygone with higher draw order value are drawn on top of polygons with lower draw order. In case multiple polygons have the same draw order value then the order in which they were added to the scene matters. Last added polygone is drawn on top. Allowed range is 0-1023. Values outside this range will be clamped.

        Parameters:
        value -

        MapPolygon draw order. Polygons with higher draw order value are drawn on top of polygons with lower draw order. In case multiple polygons have the same draw order value then the order in which they were added to the scene matters. Last added polygon is drawn on top. Allowed range is 0-1023. Values outside this range will be clamped. Default value is 0.
